intro: Erodium marcuccii, commonly known as the Cape York geranium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pinkish to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal regions. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Erodium marcuccii is adapted to arid conditions and is often seen in coastal dunes and heathlands.
